item.title: No15 Bartholomew st: Building waste left in the front porch for months, 31st January
item.description:
Building waste from renovation works has been left in the shared front porch of a privately owned listed house for several months. I have repeatedly asked the owner to clear the waste but he responds with little action stating his builder’s unavailability. . The porch is a communal access area and not suitable for storage of construction materials or waste. The waste is unsightly, causes ongoing hygiene concerns, and negatively affects the character and setting of a listed building. I am requesting council enforcement action to require prompt removal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Bartholomew Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crown lane on grass neatest sidewalk., 31st January
item.description:
At 06:54am car pulls up with the male driver getting out of car with a black labador. Keeps it on the lead but doesn't pick up dog mess. Get a green bag out acting like he is but actually leaves the dogs shit on the green. Goes back to car and drives off. A young boy age between 10- 12 years in the back of the car waiting for the driver and his dog to return to the car.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light stuck on red, 31st January
item.description:
The lights turning right from hayes lane onto Bromley common are stuck on red until a car from homesdale road turning right appears. It has been like this for months and have been stuck there for over 5 minutes this morning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned white van with alarm sounding, 31st January
item.description:
White van left in Nathaniel Court with constant alarm sounding all evening and night. Alarm can be heard throughout the neighbourhood, along Green Lanes & Coster Avenue.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Green Lanes, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor street lighting, 30th January
item.description:
When i come home and walk on hawstead and Medusa road se6, usually there is no street lighting and it is pitch black. I have an injured toe & a few times I have become very scared, uneasy and almost panicked as you cant even see where you are walking. It’s very scary. Please make the road visible again as it’s obvious they are being turned off. I have mentioned this on a number of forums and responses are being noted. If anything happens I will definitely take things further.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Morena Street, Ladywell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
